des:
ELAN SKILL for Amazon Alexa extends that elegant control & flexibility you've come to expect from ELAN to the sound of your own voice. Now, you have a voice with ELAN.

With the ELAN SKILL for Amazon Alexa, you can now interact with your ELAN devices by voice. To get started, select the “Enable SKILL” button in the Alexa App to link your skill name/company name account and discover your devices. Find more information about connecting smart home devices at Connect a Smart Home Device to Alexa.

When using the SKILL, you need established names for your devices. There are two ways to define these names:

- Use the names you previously set up. They are shown in the ELAN app and can be changed

- Create an Alexa group, like Bedroom or Downstairs, and add the device to the group. More information is available at Create a Smart Home Device Group.

Once you know the name or group name for your devices, you can say the following:

"Alexa, turn on Bedroom."
"Alexa, set Downstairs temperature to 72 degrees."

Requires ELAN 8.2.3x software or later, released February 20, 2018. This SKILL and related hardware must be installed and configured by a certified ELAN dealer.

The SKILL content is in English.
